page.title: 05Newborough Primary School
page.content: The{Meynell C.E.(A) Primary School} was built at the turn of the century from monies collected in the village. In{Sept 1985}3 village schools were amalgamated{(Newborough, Hanbury & {Hoar Cross)}and centred in{Newborough It is a{mixed}school from{5}to{11}yrs with{44}children on roll, 3 classrooms one also used as gym & dining hall. No uniform is worn and there are 3 full time teaching staff. { Subjects}- Core subjects, RI (with a vicar from Hanbury or Hoar Cross), {computer studies,}PE & games.{TV}& {radio}are widely used. Children swim weekly at a nearby secondary school. There is a{PTA}to deal with fund raising and various school activities. There are hard based playgrounds and grass playing fields round the school. Popular playtime games include 'Kiss & Chase' and 'Hopscotch'
